themes.label: Decrees
themes.rationale: The text is a formal decree of the Athenian Demos, indicated by the standard formula 'ἔδοξεν τῶι δήμωι' (it was decided by the people).

themes.label: Honorific Inscriptions
themes.rationale: The inscription honors the prytaneis of the tribe Erechtheis with praise and a golden crown for their service to the state.
themes.quote: [ο τε ν μοι κα τ ψηφ σματα το δ μου παιν σ]αι το ς πρυτ νεις τ ς ρε[χθε δος κα στεφαν σαι α το ς χρυσ ι στεφ νωι κ]ατ τ ν ν μον

themes.label: Stele
themes.rationale: The text explicitly commands the recording of the decree on a stone stele to be set up in the Prytanikon.
themes.quote: ναγρ ψ[αι] [δ τ δε τ ψ φισμα τ ν γραμματ α τ ν κατ πρυτ]ανε αν ε ς στ λην λιθ [νην]

themes.label: Marble
themes.rationale: While the text uses the generic term for stone (lithinen), Athenian state decrees of this period were almost exclusively inscribed on marble.
themes.ambiguity_note: The text specifies 'stone' (lithinen), but marble is the standard material for Athenian state decrees of this period.

themes.label: Fragmentary
themes.rationale: The text contains significant lacunae and restorations, indicating the original stone is in a fragmentary state.
themes.quote: [ π νικοδ μου ρχοντος π τ ς α γε δος τρ]της πρυτανε ας

rationale: This is an Athenian honorific decree dated to the archonship of Nikodemos (122/1 BC). It records the report of the prytaneis of the tribe Erechtheis regarding sacrifices made to Apollo Prostaterios and other deities for the welfare of the Council, the People, and their allies. In recognition of their diligent administration and religious duties, the Demos votes to praise and crown the prytaneis, ordering the decree to be set up on a stone stele in the Prytanikon.
